definitions.text: low land that is seasonally flooded; has more woody plants than a marsh and better drainage than a bog
a situation fraught with difficulties and imponderables
examples: he was trapped in a medical swamp

definitions.text: drench or submerge or be drenched or submerged
examples: The tsunami swamped every boat in the harbor

definitions.text: fill quickly beyond capacity; as with a liquid
examples: the basement was inundated after the storm
